post.author: NX-317
post.body:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FOC859_TLHA - interesting experiment with gravity. Shows the realism of Prey gravity system.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hd7CHdy4O5c - experiment with portals. Tried to repeat some common situations from the game Portal.

post.author: Tron
post.body:
That first video is mine. Part of a series of tests I have been doing of the limitations of the Prey physics engine. May or may not come to a released map depending on if I get time (extremely busy with other things at the moment)

Your portals video is quite interesting, shows how much potential there is in the engine still while also showing off a lot of the limitations. Definitely not as flexible as Portal, however with well planned situations a lot of convincing effects can be pulled off.

post.author: NX-317
post.body:
So there is a chance that there will be new SP map? Very good news!

Thanks for the feedback about the video. I would have used some of these convincing effects in my SF map if I found out about them earlier.

post.author: aardwolf
post.body: Amazing that this game is installed at all in a computer these days.

post.author: RangerMcFriendly
post.body: I wish I could buy this game on steam

post.author: aardwolf
post.body:
RangerMcFriendly wrote:
I wish I could buy this game on steam


Someone can gift it to you.

post.author: RangerMcFriendly
post.body: If they have a copy of it to gift, yes, but who would have a copy just waiting to be gifted? That wasn't the point though. You can't buy it on steam anymore. I'll just have to find a retail copy of it.

post.author: aardwolf
post.body:
RangerMcFriendly wrote:
If they have a copy of it to gift, yes, but who would have a copy just waiting to be gifted? That wasn't the point though. You can't buy it on steam anymore. I'll just have to find a retail copy of it.


They can buy the game as gift.

post.author: Tron
post.body:
aardwolf wrote:
RangerMcFriendly wrote:
If they have a copy of it to gift, yes, but who would have a copy just waiting to be gifted? That wasn't the point though. You can't buy it on steam anymore. I'll just have to find a retail copy of it.


They can buy the game as gift.


You can't, for some reason Valve has had trouble getting more Prey keys and the games purchase page doesn't even exist anymore.

post.author: RangerMcFriendly
post.body:
Tron is right.

3d realms or whoever used a special keygen to generate a certain amount of keys. Apparently they can't make anymore keys without risking a repeat of current keys. They should log all keys created next time.

post.author: simulation
post.body: UK and US eBay have loads of new sealed copies of Prey; it isn't hard to get

post.author: The Happy Friar
post.body:
you can still find prey in some retail stores too. Look in the under $30/30 racks.

worth it.

post.author: RangerMcFriendly
post.body:
I didn't want to go off topic, but I can just order a copy off of Amazon.com and get prime shipping for free. Those videos look pretty cool, I like gravity one the best.

Hopefully it will work, unlike the Quake 4 retail I bought

post.author: aardwolf
post.body: I bought quake 4 retail too, the key worked without trouble.

post.author: aardwolf
post.body: didnt know about the situation with prey. Shoulndt really matter since the prey masterservers which check keys went down a long time ago.

post.author: Neurological
post.body: They should put it on Gog, even if is not so old.
